Also I think that the whole Rey going to the dark side thing and her training shouldâ(TM)ve been further developed\, and I think It was disjointed a bit because Rian Johnson came in with It set up for him\, but he had the freedom to make It how he wanted and in some ways he seemingly disregarded the intentions Abrams had for it(like killing Snoke so soon)\, which is all great and i love the direction he took this movie in\, and the flare he brought to the series. Overall\, despite its troubles\, the last Jedi accomplishes Johnsonâ(TM)s goal of making his mark on the Star Wars universe\, showing that not all things have to be the same as they used to be\, and that moving on from the old and entering into the new is important. These themes helped create a Star Wars movie that is unlike the others\, defying the expectations that were set for it and moving away from the old and embracing the new.
